I completely agree with Milan. The best way to solve your issues with a shared database is to ***not use a shared database***.
Although shared database development is supported, it's only a viable solution for _small_ teams working closely together that are able to communicate and work around breaking changes created by parallel work in the same area of an application.
Most of our customers and partners are using Xperience's CI/CD features.
In addition to the documentation Milan linked to, there is a blog post on the Community Portal - [Xperience by Kentico CI/CD developer scenarios](https://community.kentico.com/blog/xperience-by-kentico-ci-cd-developer-scenarios) - which has many helpful best practices for teams using Xperience's CI/CD features.
